physical_appearance:The image shows a photograph in black-and-white. It has a black frame and its border is white in colour. The background of the photograph is predominantly filled with clouds. There is a clock that is attached to one of the ceiling walls from the side. The hour hand stands at the numeral twelve
 while the minute hand points to the middle of the numerals five and six. The face of the clock is circular in shape and the numeric system is represented by Roman numerals.
subject_terms_1:railroad stations historic monuments clocks
subject_terms_2:Black-and-white photography Historic monuments Railroad stations Clocks and watches Pertadbiran Keretapi Tanah Melayu Tanjong Pagar (Singapore)
subject_terms_3:Rail transport Tanjong Pagar Railway Station Pertadbiran Keretapi Tanah Melayu Photography Rail transport (Stations)
sgcool_label_text:\This image shows the iconic clock of the Tanjong Pagar railway station. The station was known for its Art Deco and neo-classical architectural styles. Designed by Swan and Maclaren
 the entrance of the station is sheltered by an arched portico. This image is part of the \\Tracking Memories\\ collection by the late Mr Kwek Leng Joo. The collection captures different aspects of the Malayan Railway story in Singapore

metadata.creator_2: Kwek Leng Joo Swan and Maclaren Architects
metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph in black-and-white. It has a black frame and its border is white in colour. The background of the photograph is predominantly filled with clouds. There is a clock that is attached to one of the ceiling walls from the side. The hour hand stands at the numeral twelve, while the minute hand points to the middle of the numerals five and six. The face of the clock is circular in shape and the numeric system is represented by Roman numerals.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: "This image shows the iconic clock of the Tanjong Pagar railway station. The station was known for its Art Deco and neo-classical architectural styles. Designed by Swan and Maclaren, the entrance of the station is sheltered by an arched portico. This image is part of the ""Tracking Memories"" collection by the late Mr Kwek Leng Joo. The collection captures different aspects of the Malayan Railway story in Singapore
